findings.lower_chest: Visualized lung fields are within normal limits. There is no evidence of pleural or pericardial effusion.

abdomen.hepatobiliary: The liver demonstrates homogenous low attenuation compatible with hepatosteatosis. There is no evidence of focal lesions or biliary dilatation. The gallbladder is within normal limits.
abdomen.pancreas: The pancreas has normal attenuation, without evidence of focal lesions or pancreatic ductal dilatation.
abdomen.spleen: The spleen shows normal size and attenuation, without evidence of focal lesions.
abdomen.adrenals: The right and left adrenal glands are normal in size and shape.
abdomen.urinary: Multiple subcentimeter hypodense round lesions in the right kidney, with the largest measuring 6 mm, are too small to characterize and grossly stable. The kidneys are normal in size with no hydronephrosis.
abdomen.gastrointestinal: The stomach is unremarkable. Small bowel loops demonstrate normal caliber, wall thickness, and enhancement. The colon and rectum are within normal limits. The appendix is dilated (8 mm) with thickened hyperemic wall and periappendiceal fat stranding.
abdomen.pelvis: The urinary bladder and distal ureters are unremarkable with no free fluid.

findings.vascular: No abdominal aortic aneurysm or atherosclerotic disease noted.
findings.bones: No evidence of worrisome osseous lesions or acute fracture.
findings.soft_tissues: The abdominal and pelvic wall is within normal limits.
